definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: Heavy seas broke over the bows.
sentences.chinese: 驚濤駭浪朝着船頭衝打過來。

sentences.english: Life just like an ocean, not always calm maybe paradises sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 生活就像大海不總是風平浪靜也有驚濤駭浪時。

sentences.english: One billowy river appeared in front of the Cowhand.
sentences.chinese: 一條驚濤駭浪的河在牧牛工前面出現。

sentences.english: Apparently, the article has inspired heated back-and-forths on industry e-mail lists.
sentences.chinese: 顯然，文章在業內的電郵名單中掀起了驚濤駭浪。

sentences.english: This ship is clearly in motion, violently rocking against the waves of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 船顯然在行進，在驚濤駭浪間猛烈地顛簸。

sentences.english: Some call it "horse Jingtao as anger."
sentences.chinese: 有人稱之爲“如怒馬驚濤”。

sentences.english: The sailors began to prepare against a rough night.
sentences.chinese: 海員們開始準備應付一個驚濤駭浪之夜。

sentences.english: Do not experience the pain of fall, who will care tempestuous waves of Qingning?
sentences.chinese: 不經歷分崩離析的痛苦，誰會在意驚濤駭浪的清寧？

sentences.english: The waves thunder upon the shore.
Search in the depth of the fussed ocean.
A sea filled pool with crashing surf.
sentences.chinese: 一個由拍岸驚濤注滿的海池。

sentences.english: The ship was tossed by the ocean billows in the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那條船在海上的驚濤駭浪中顛簸。

sentences.english: EXAMPLE: Champion surfers are attracted to the gnarly surf along the eastern Australian coast.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亞東海岸的驚濤駭浪吸引着一流的衝浪好手。

sentences.english: Seagulls hover over the surging waves.
sentences.chinese: 海鷗在驚濤駭浪上翱翔。

sentences.english: Lift Jingtao Pinghai waves, wings to fly with the times.
sentences.chinese: “平海驚濤掀巨浪，與時俱進展翅飛”。

definition: lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
Milky Way/also called 銀河|银河[Yin2 he2]
nuée ardente/hot cloud of volcanic ash
to cut off/to interrupt/to prevent access
in large numbers/in force/lit. clouds bubbling up
